column2: The Candidate will be working in the Robotics Team as a Robotic Engineer / Lead, Candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing software and hardware solutions that enable robots to perform tasks autonomously and candidate must be able to take responsibilities of the project independently and working hands on along with the customers & team to ensure the successful completion of the onsite robot application.          Required Experience:          Exposure on Process of BIW / Handling / Assembly lines are preferred.      2 to 5 Years of Onsite experience in assembly line, handling lines and BIW Offline Programming.      Experience as a Robot programmer from integrators, solution and service providing industries are preferred.      Experience of Automotive is must.          Required Knowledge:          Exposure to onsite Robot Programming for Articulated Robot (like ABB, FANUC, YASKAWA, KUKA, KAWASAKI & NACHI), SCARA Robot like (Mitsubishi, Omron), COBOT and Robot vision system (like Fanuc, ABB & Cognex) etc.      Onsite Robot, 3rd party devices configuration and programming experience is compulsory.      Hands on Experience on Robot software and additional software configuration is compulsory.      Knowledge of Industrial Networking and communications protocol like Modbus, TCP, Ethernet TCP / IP, Device Net, Profinet, Profibus, EtherCAT etc.      Knowledge of third party devices like OBARA, Yaskawa Weld Controller, Tip Dresser, Water Saver unit etc.      Exposure on OEM Standards and requirements. Preferred OEM like (FORD / GM / VW / BMW / Stellantis / Daimler etc.)      Knowledge of Handling Tool Validations, Generating Paths & also Configuration of EOAT s as per Applications etc.      Event Based Simulation Knowledge, monitor the use of robotic systems and optimize their functionality to optimize the Cycle Time will be desired      Prototypes and work on necessary components (e.g. Spot Welding, Hemming, Silent, MIG Welding, Material Handling/ Assembly)      Knowledge on Layouts / Line Simulation, PLC, HMI, SCADA and Robotic simulation software and Vision system will be an added advantage.      Kinematics for the Fixtures, Weld Guns and other EOAT s knowledge will be preferred.      Onsite / Manufacturing / Shop floor experience is compulsory.      Preparation & Completion of Process Documentation as per Standards.          Key Responsibilities:          Conduct in-detailed application study with customers to understand their automation needs and execute the right automation solution using      Continuously review and analysis robotics trends to develop advanced robotics solutions for different application.      Evaluate customer specifications, write efficient & logical programs for a variety of applications using robots.      Program and demonstrate proof-of-concept (POC) for robotics solutions for clients.      Take complete ownership of the projects and keep track of the application project blueprints, responsible for efficient project management.      Execute the troubleshooting (mechanical & Electrical) for robotic application issues and maintain the documentation of troubleshooting procedures.      Provide technical support (hardware & Software) to the customers to understand the problems/issues on the application and communicate same with internal stakeholder to provide best solution to end users.      Conduct OJT (On the Job Training) for internal and external stakeholders and maintain the training records.      Coordination with internal departments to ensure the project application is executed within TAT and positioned effectively.      Study and develop industrywide Kinematics for the Fixtures, Weld Guns and other EOAT s      BIW Product / Process Structure development. Must be able to suggest process changes.      Provide complete Installation & Commissioning support in customer facilities for start-up, debug, training & final System acceptance.      Perform integration tests and quality control to develop cost-effective and efficient processes for manufacturing.
column11: Biw, Automation, Mechatronics, Simulation, Project management, Instrumentation, Manager Quality Control, Automotive, Material handling, SCADA

column2: Responsible for executing Electrical Engineering technical disciplines with primary focus on design, development, modification of Electrical hardware systems.                      Selection of OEM components and materials for Power distribution box / control panel design.                      Creation of electrical schematics and system interconnects based on requirements received from cross-disciplinary teams.                      Create and release engineering drawings & bill of materials using Engineering Change Management process.                      Well versed with Part life cycle management, Obsolescence management activities                      Interact with PG counterpart in US.                      Study and recommend corrective solutions for technical issues of varying complexities.                      Provide immediate response and timely resolution to design related production issues encountered during the build process.                      Conduct and drive Design review to get buy-in from all cross functional teams                      Be able to highlight high complexity technical risks and drive mitigation plans during project execution.                      Maintain and develop process checkpoints to ensure adherence to design standards and schedules. Work with leadership peers to drive process improvements as necessary.                        Mandatory Skills                    Highly proficient in Control panel Electrical Circuit Design with Safety Interlocks, programmable logic controllers with detailed understanding of relevant standards and compliances like - NEC, NFPA, UL 508, IEC standard, SEMI Standard (Electrical), etc.,                      Expert in application of industrial automation control panel design concepts to electrical safety, creation of electrical schematic diagram and control panel facility connections & field disconnects.                      Proficient in system level understanding of Electrical architecture, design of IO Controllers and Applications.                      Working knowledge on application of power and controls technologies for systems automation                      Must have worked on electrical engineering CAD tools like ORCAD, ZUKEN or equivalent CAD packages for circuit design & simulation.                        Desirable Skills                    Familiar with PCB Applications for control panel Design and must have basic understanding of PCB design and component selection.                      Experience with capital equipment or similar (for e.g., process industries, medical instrumentation, automotive, aircraft, etc.) industry in a sub-system / module design project.                      Experience in working with cross-disciplinary teams (including mechanical, electro-mechanical, software, process, manufacturing engineers) for major projects with multi-national work environment.                      Experience in selection of components, setting up equipment for experimentation / testing in laboratory environment, setting up safe practices.                      Knowledge in Engineering Change Management Process                      Project Management
column11: Automation, Simulation, Project management, Circuit designing, CAD, Instrumentation, PCB designing, Control panel, ORCAD, Automotive

Technical Project Management expertise                      Lead Failure Mode Avoidance activities including DFMEA, quality history reviews development tests. Lead the resolution of design, attribute or packaging incompatibilities through the appropriate    cross-functional meetings.                          Support Purchasing team in Sourcing and RFQ activities.                          Support vehicle launch and pre-production builds (both virtual and physical)                          Supplier interaction for manufacturing and part development.                      Coordination between Supplier - Offshore team - Chief Eng.(OEM).                      Part development experience is added advantage                      Ensuring the effective application of APQP to manage system/ component delivery.              Knowledge / Experience - 8 to 12 Years                          Proven project management capability demonstrated by recent delivery in line with time, Cost, quality attribute targets                      Proven experience in development and/or integration of at least one and preferably more on IP ( Hard and soft ) , Glove box , Floor Console (Arm rest , Bin, Bezels, Structures etc.)                          Engineering knowledge of defined component(s) / system(s) design, function, performance, production manufacturing requirements,                      Excellent communications skills, demonstrated ability to communicate at all levels                      Liaise with supplier, Manufacturing, CAEValidation Teams.                      PC Literacy: Microsoft Project, Power Point, Excel, Word etc                      CAD Literacy: Ability to generate CAD data and Master sections in CATIA V5/NX.                      Significant experience in use of engineering tools FMEA, Six Sigma, problem resolution etc.                      Successful history of delivery within the automotive sector.          Qualification:                      BE/B. Tech in Mechanical/Production/ Automotive Engineering

column1: Onsite_ Mechanical Engineers- Assembly Machines& Automation Technology
column2: Onsite_ Mechanical Engineers- Assembly Machines& Automation Technology   If meeting the below criteria,   Please share your CV to jagannaath@kamms.net and also Whatsapp @ 7092689999   Candidates must be from Machine Building Companies( Machine manufacturing companies) and must know in and out of the machines/ complete machine building and than mechanical commissioning of the machines. Required Profile: The candidates must be from Machine Building Companies (Only CNC/HMC/VMC/5- Axis Machines mfg Companies) And you must know in and out of the machines and than Mechanical Installations/ commissioning of the machines including   German Onsite (1 Year and US Onsite (6 Years) : This position is for  USA Projects for minimum 1 year onsite to Germany for training at Company's HO at Germany and 6 years Onsite to USA with excellent onsite allowances apart from regular Indian Salary. About Company: The company is family oriented 100 years old German MNC. They give utmost priority for the welfare of the employee and the another beauty is that there is no retirement age in this company so that you can work as long as you can work. Those who are looking for long term, say minimum 5 years only need to apply...We are not strictly looking for 2-3 years candidates. Job description Position Name: Mechanical machine Installations and Commissioning Gerometry Engineers  Base Location:  Anantapur District, Andhra Pradesh Job Type:  Permanent/Full Time This position is responsible for assembly / Dis-assembly of Precision Mechanical Sub-assemblies like Motorized Spindles, High Speed CNC Machine Tool Spindles, Gear Boxes, Overhauling of Machining centers and Sub-Assemblies. The position requires strong mechanical aptitude, an in-depth knowledge of Mechanical Drawings, Fits & Drawing Tolerances, Class of Bearings, Quality Requirements of Parts being assembled in Machines and an understanding of assembly technology Roles & Responsibilities Must respond quickly to the tasks given to him / her for Repair / Assemble New and Various sub-assemblies of Machines / CNC Machining Centers (Horizontal & Vertical) Repair / Assemble New or refurbished assemblies of Spindles, Gear Boxes Experience in Dis-assembly / assembly, Adjust and check geometry of Machine subassemblies of CNC Machining center and special purpose Machines will have added advantage Experience in Performing Renishaw Ball Bar Geometry Measurement on CNC Horizontal Machining center will have added advantage. Utilize precision measuring instruments (such as calipers, levels, indicators, micrometers, Balancing Equipment, etc.). Dealing with high-precision measuring equipment and required familiarity with initial geometric relations the previous work. Read and follow mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic, and electrical prints/drawings Experience in setting and function tests of the actuators and sensors on sub- assemblies in Machining centers and Special purpose machines Education and Experience Requirements  Bachelors Degree / Diploma in Mechanical Engineering preferred  Previous Experience in CNC Machine Tool Manufacturing industry assembly department  Previous CNC machine building experience preferred  3-5 years relevant experience preferably from CNC Machine Tool Manufacturing industry General Requirements  Ability to work in Service Department in the Field  Self-motivated; able to work alone or in a team environment  Full understanding of the metric system / Imperial System  Strong math skills  Willing to work overtime as needed  Willing to Work Long Term overseas Projects
column11: Machine Installations, Installation, Geometry Measurement, Service, Machine Commissioning, CNC Horizontal Machining, Commissioning, Geometry, Sub-Assemblies., CNC Machine Tool Spindles, Assembly Machines, Fixtures, Motorized Spindles

column2: An energetic person who is capable of working as part of a team & perform qualification and validation of new product development and/or sustaining programs at manufacturing and assembly stage. Deliver the product with quality & compliance. Design, develop, and execute manufacturing test strategies and plans around the requirements & improve test efficiency by tools.      ?     JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:        Manufacturing Engineer supporting design, develop, and verify test process, test system, test software and fixtures for quality delivery of equipment.      Basic knowledge on Fire Domain/products is added advantage.      Good knowledge of Hardware Simulators/ Hardware Test Jigs/ Automation Hardware or Software.      Good understanding of manufacturing lifecycle for Product Development & Sustenance      Good Experience with PCB manufacturing and assembly of electronics components      UL, LPCB, EN certification understanding and knowledge.      Good working experience with Validation and compliance procedures for electronics parts/equipment.      Good knowledge with sensors and data acquisition for analysis and improvement purposes.      Define, develop, deploy, and maintain test systems from new product development stage till product end of life support stage.      Support test system set-ups, as well as maintenance and improvement activities.      Continuously work to improve test processes and test tools to improvise quality, performance, repeatability & cost      Manage test plans, test specifications that conform to the technical and functional specifications for electronics products.      Manage test Documentation and test data and present test results as per the Quality policies and procedures throughout the product lifecycle.      Contributes ideas on product and process improvements. Participates in design review sessions/PFMEA sessions with cross functional teams.      Adhere to Quality Standards for Fire domain products and enhancements.            Benefits:               We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.             Have peace of mind and body with our health insurance             Make yourself a priority with flexible schedules and leave Policy                     Drive forward your career through professional development opportunities Achieve your personal goals with our Employee Assistance Program.

column2: Youll have a chance to get hands-on experience with VOLVO products. This is your chance to join one of the Top Employer companies in India and embrace new career challenges within the automotive industry                 This position will report to the Group Manager Pneumatic and Electrical Installation Bangalore                     ROLE DESCRIPTION                     Have operational responsibility for the pneumatic & Electrical wiring installation in the layout.             Have the capacity to work individually or with a small team actively to secure the deliverables.             Play an active role in the delivery.             Integrate deliveries from others and secure quality and readiness before release             Ensure the deliveries are made as per the requirement and timelines.             Frequent interactions with their counterparts, clarify the requirements and deliver accordingly.             Develops and implements pneumatic & wiring installation projects within the area of assignment including related routing and clipping solutions             Communicates relevant design and project requirements to external design counterpart as applicable if the detailed design is performed by an outside entity             Ensures design correctness and completeness for all pneumatic & wiring installation                                 REQUIRED COMPETENCIES                     Customer focus             Decision quality             Collaborates             Action-oriented             Demonstrates self-awareness             Ability to analyze and solve complex problems                         REQUIRED EDUCATION                   BE/ BTech / M.Tech / MS in Mechanical Engineering or related field                                     EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, TRAINING                     BE/ BTech / M.Tech/MS in Mechanical Engineering             2 to 4 years of automotive experience preferably in the truck industry             Hands-on experience in the Creo and PDM tool.             Experience in Agile way of working             Strong in engineering fundamentals.             Knowledge in the design and development of sheet metal brackets.             Knowledge in the Creo cabling module is an added advantage.             Knowledge in mechatronics is an added advantage. column2: Senior Electrical Engineer will be an individual contributor within Medtronic Neuromodulation Patient Care Devices team     Responsible for providing electrical engineering for non-implantable medical devices and related accessories to produce and sustain highly reliable products that provide an excellent customer experience     Typical product designs involve complex electronic circuits, wireless communication and a mix of consumer and medical technologies             A Day in the Life               This Sr EE role is expected to provide Electrical Engineering support to analyze, characterize, and debug the design, including analog and digital circuitry     Not only will this resource provide immediate technical support to the Firmware VT and Manufacturing Test teams at MEIC but will also provide real-time EE support on any issues impacting the Test and/or Build lines in Malaysia     This resource is also expected to work closely with design teams (Electrical, Firmware, Mechanical) to root cause design issues, create test suites, characterize and ultimately verify electrical designs         Position Responsibilities:         Be part of a global electrical team to strive for functional excellence in all aspects of daily work.      Define and develop tests and test methods to meet product requirements.     Provide electrical engineering skills to design, develop, analyze, characterize, and debug new product designs including analog and digital circuitry.     Work closely with design team (electrical, firmware, mechanical) to root cause design issues, create test suites, and characterize and ultimately verify electrical designs.     Collaborate with a cross functional team to resolve and document issues with fielded product.      Design and execute test methods to characterize electrical performance and verify adherence to product requirements.     Analysis of product performance using DFSS techniques     Execute manual and automated tests including fixturing.     Develop test methods and interface with certified test houses to verify/certify to global regulatory standards including IEC60601, EN45502, FCC, ETSI, etc     Act as a liaison with external suppliers to ensure continuity of product supply by resolving supply and quality issues.     Work under minimal supervision.     Ensure understanding of all quality policy/system items that are personally applicable.      Follow all work/quality procedures to ensure quality system compliance and high-quality work.     Ability to work with others internationally and travel globally.             Must Have: Minimum Requirements               bachelors degree in a technical discipline Electrical Engineering     Minimum of 10 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 8 years relevant experience         Nice to Have             Experience with designing and debugging electromechanical products.     Experience with verification and validation of class II and class III medical devices     Experience with Design for Six Sigma.      Experience developing automated test benches utilizing python scripts and/or LABVIEW.     Experience validating test scripts, methods and systems including IQ/OQ      Experience with Altium or OrCAD schematic capture and PCB layout tools     Experience with circuit simulation tools such as PSPICE, LTSPICE     Experience with international teams and Contract Manufacturers Globally

column2: As a 2-Wheeler Test Engineer specializing in Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) functions, you will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, functionality, and testing of ADAS features specifically designed for two-wheeled vehicles. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including software developers, testing personnel to conduct comprehensive testing and validation of ADAS algorithms, and systems.          Main Focus:          Conduct comprehensive test rides on motorcycles, focusing on performance, handling, and safety aspects.      Possess expert-level skills in handling powerful 1000 cc + motorcycles, understanding their dynamics and capabilities.      Navigate bikes skillfully through curves, bends, and corners, assessing their stability and responsiveness under different riding condition.          Test Execution:          Execute test cases to validate the performance, accuracy, and robustness of ADAS algorithms in simulated and real-world riding conditions. Usage of reference system for testing      Utilize testing tools, equipment, and methodologies to conduct functional, regression, and performance testing.          Data Collection and Analysis:          Collect, analyze, and interpret test data to identify issues, anomalies, and areas for improvement in ADAS functionality.      Work closely with data analysis team to correlate test results with system behavior and performance metrics.          Cross-Functional Collaboration:          Collaborate with software developers, and other stakeholders to understand system architecture, requirements, and constraints      Participate in design reviews, sprint planning, and other cross-functional meetings to provide input on ADAS feature implementation and integration              Test Reporting and Tracking          Document and report software defects, anomalies, and test findings using issue tracking systems.      Collaborate with development teams to prioritize and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.          Continuous Improvement and Agile mindset:          Stay updated with the latest advancements in ADAS technology, industry trends, and regulatory requirements.      Propose and implement process improvements, tools, and methodologies to enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness          Technical Education: Background in automotive domain, Mtech/Btech/BE in Mechanical / Electrical / Electronics / Automotive.      Previous Testing Experience: Prior experience in motorcycle testing or racing would be advantage.
